hanzi-su-wiki:
悼

Значения

Оплакивать, скорбеть

Мнемоника

Возноситься сердцем 忄 высоко 卓, к небесам, где витает душа недавно умершего.
purpleculture_pinyin:
dào
to mourn; to lament
чтобы оплакивать; сетовать
rtega_mnemonic:
悼悼RSgrieve, mourn, lament
  • heart 忄 profoundly 卓 touched: grieving
  • heart 忄 on the table 卓
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 卓 indicates the sound; 忄 (heart) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
哀悼 [ āi dào ]: to grieve over sb's death; to lament sb's death; mourning
悼念 [ dào niàn ]: to grieve
追悼会 [ zhuī dào huì ]: memorial service; funeral service
追悼 [ zhuī dào ]: to mourn; to pay last respects; mourning; memorial (service etc)
悼词 [ dào cí ]: memorial speech; eulogy
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 忄 [ xīn ] heart; mind; soul
    • 卓 [ zhuō ] profound, lofty, brilliant
heisig_chinese_memo: When the world's most eminent magician died, everyone's state of mind became that of lamentation. He was buried and mourned with his famous sun-flower wand in his hand.
heisig_constituent: lament, Freud, state of mind, eminent, magic wand, augury, sun, day, ten, needle
heisig_story: To keep this character distinct from others of similar connotation, one need only think of the Prophet Jeremiah whose poetry gave an eminence to the state of mind we call lamentation.
koohiiStory1: When the world´s most eminent magician died, everyone´s state of mind became that of lamentation. He was buried with his famous sun-flower wand in his hand.
koohiiStory2: Data laments that he could never see his eminent father, his creator, ever again. He paints a picture of his father, that looks like a sunflower in the shape of a magic wand.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The soul in your toe leaves early. You grieve and mourn for your now-dead toe.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Look at your toe. It has no soul. It's dark and shriveled, like a mummy's toe. Grieve and watch your tears drip onto it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You decide to grieve in とうきょう. Your toe always wanted to walk in とうきょう, and now you can at least fulfill its dying wish.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Walk through the streets of とうきょう grieving, with your dead toe flopping onto the pavement.
Ru_Radicals: 十 (десять), 卜 (гадание), 忙 (занятой), 日 (день)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a superior (卓) heart (忄) grieves
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When the world's most eminent magician died, everyone's state of mind became that of lamentation. He was buried and mourned with his famous sun-flower wand in his hand.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " heart ", the sound of " zhuo " expresses fear. "Shuowen": "Fear. Chen Chu said that fear is mourning. From the heart, the sound." "The Songs of the Chu‧Nine Chapters‧Thinking": "I wish to take leisure and observe myself, but not dare to mourn. "

" Mourning " also expresses sadness. "Poetry·Weifeng·Mang": "Quietly speaking and thinking, bow is mourning!"

" Mourning " also specifically refers to remembering the dead. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long‧ Mourning": "Sorrow with resignation, cover without tears.

" Mourning " also refers to young people. "Book of Rites-Qu Lishang": "Eighty-nine-nine-ten is the old man, and seven years is the mourning. Although the mourning and the old man are guilty, no punishment is imposed."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " heart ", the sound of " zhuo " expresses fear.
humanum_full_description:
從「心」，「卓」聲，表示恐懼。《說文》：「懼也。陳楚謂懼曰悼。从心，卓聲。」《楚辭‧九章‧抽思》：「願承閒而自察兮，心震悼而不敢。」

　　「悼」也表示哀傷。《詩‧衛風‧氓》：「靜言思之，躬是悼矣！」

　　「悼」還特指追念死者。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧哀吊》：「以辭遣哀，蓋不淚之悼。」

　　「悼」也指年幼的人。《禮記‧曲禮上》：「八十九十曰耄，七年曰悼，悼與耄雖有罪不加刑焉。」

從「 心 」，「 卓 」聲，表示恐懼。《說文》：「懼也。陳楚謂懼曰悼。从心，卓聲。」《楚辭‧九章‧抽思》：「願承閒而自察兮，心震悼而不敢。」 「 悼 」也表示哀傷。《詩‧衛風‧氓》：「靜言思之，躬是悼矣！」 「 悼 」還特指追念死者。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧哀吊》：「以辭遣哀，蓋不淚之悼。」 「 悼 」也指年幼的人。《禮記‧曲禮上》：「八十九十曰耄，七年曰悼，悼與耄雖有罪不加刑焉。」
From the " heart", the sound of " zhuo" expresses fear. "Shuowen": "Fear. Chen Chu said that fear is mourning. From the heart, the sound." "The Songs of the Chu‧Nine Chapters‧Thinking": "I wish to take leisure and observe myself, but not dare to mourn. " " Mourning" also expresses sadness. "Poetry·Weifeng·Mang": "Quietly speaking and thinking, bow is mourning!" " Mourning" also specifically refers to remembering the dead. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long‧ Mourning": "Sorrow with resignation, cover without tears. " Mourning" also refers to young people. "Book of Rites-Qu Lishang": "Eighty-nine-nine-ten is the old man, and seven years is the mourning. Although the mourning and the old man are guilty, no punishment is imposed."

悼字的基本解释

悼
dào
悲伤，哀念：哀悼。追悼。悼念。悼亡。悼唁。悼词。悼惜。

悼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dào］
［《廣韻》徒到切，去号，定。］
(1)伤感，哀伤。
(2)特指对死者的怀念、哀痛。
(3)追念；追悔。
(4)恐惧；颤抖。
(5)指年幼的人。
(6)夭亡。古代谥号用词。

悼字的英文翻译

◎ 悼
grieve, mourn

悼字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　悼； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页389第13
【唐韻】徒到切【集韻】【韻會】大到切【正韻】杜到切，?音導。【廣韻】傷也。【詩·邶風】中心是悼。　又憐愛也。【禮·曲禮】七年曰悼，雖有罪，不加?，憐其知未及，而非故犯也。　又懼也。【揚子·方言】?楚謂懼曰悼。　又【諡法】中年早夭曰悼。【春秋】晉悼公。

悼字的源字形

悼字的起名意思

暂无。

Sadness, mourning: mourning. memorial. Mourning. Mourn death. Condolences. Eulogy. Mourn.
Condolences
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dào］
["Guangyun" only to cut, go to the number, set. ]
(1) Sad, sad.
(2) Especially referring to the nostalgia and grief for the dead.
(3) Remembrance; regret.
(4) Fear; trembling.
(5) Refers to young people.
(6) Premature death. Ancient posthumous words used.

悲痛。本义是悲伤。

Цунсинь (а), печать печати имеет форму сердца, выражая печаль и печаль в сердце; Цунчжуо, высокий и праведный, выражает глубокое уважение и крайнюю скорбь по покойному.
Первоначальное значение - печаль.

Соболезнования
dào
гл.
1) печалиться, скорбеть, сожалеть, сокрушаться о...; оплакивать (умершего)
闻而悼之 узнать об этом и предаться печали
悼恩 оплакивать своего благодетеля
2) * бояться, опасаться
悼栗(栗) дрожать от страха
Radicals: 忄, ト, 早  (soul, toe, early)
Meaning Mnemonic
The soul in your toe leaves early. You grieve and mourn for your now-dead toe.
Look at your toe. It has no soul. It's dark and shriveled, like a mummy's toe. Grieve and watch your tears drip onto it.
Reading Mnemonic
You decide to grieve in とうきょう. Your toe always wanted to walk in とうきょう, and now you can at least fulfill its dying wish.
Walk through the streets of とうきょう grieving, with your dead toe flopping onto the pavement.
